episodes.title: Etsy's Craft Entrepreneurship Program in Rockford
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: To find out the latest about Etsy's Craft Entrepreneurship Program, go to http://www.craftentrepreneurship.com.

episodes.title: Collecting English Transferware: One Woman’s Story
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: One woman's passion for collecting created an unexpected opportunities when her family faced dire financial hardships.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Bone Carver
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Sylvester Ayek continues to uphold the traditions of his Alaskan Iñupiat elders: hunting, foraging, and the craft of carving walrus ivory and wood.

episodes.title: The Joy of the Ride: Pogo Boards
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: For longboard pioneers Martin and Jogi, quality craftsmanship and quality of life go hand in hand.

episodes.title: Lancashire Textiles: Last Mill Standing
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Lancashire, UK used to supply 40% of the world's cotton fabric. Today, Joe McBride is trying to keep his textile mill alive despite a changed horizon.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Quilting and Patchwork of Stellarquilts
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: This intergalactic quiltmaker stitches his fantastical narrative through the fabric of the space-time continuum. Join us on a trip to the unknown.

episodes.title: Say I love you with Etsy
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary:
Happy Valentines Day from Etsy! We crafted this just for you. 

Music by:
"Make It Up" by the Blow, courtesy of Kanine Records, by arrangement with Terrorbird Media.

episodes.title: Etsy Teams Empowering Communities: Rockford and Beyond
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Teams, those self-organized groups of Etsy members, are a serious force in the world of community support. Get inspired with this round-up of ideas.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Jerky Tracks
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Mike Sabatino and his sons are the forces behind Jerky Tracks, a gourmet jerky business born from their love of food, the great outdoors and hunting.

episodes.title: The 99 Feelings of ArtMind
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: How do you visualize the human experience — courage, happiness, hope? Ceramicist Mitsy Sleurs started with a Matryoshka doll and 99 emotions.

episodes.title: The Ties That Bind: Ayşegül & Sebahat
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Work, life and love are stitched together for a mother and daughter in Turkey, who use their bond to create one-of-a-kind wearable art.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Make a Pyramid Gift Box
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Gift wrapping should be just as interesting and heartfelt as the present within.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Upcycled Gift Wrap
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Need to wrap a gift in a hurry? All of the materials for this gift wrap how-to are readily available around the house.

episodes.title: Have a Popping Holiday!
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Master balloon-wranglers Larry Moss and Kelly Cheatle of Airigami celebrate the season with a delectable treat that will blow your mind.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Confetti Bomb
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Add even more sparkle to that bottle of sparkling wine with this eye-catching gift-wrapping tip.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Illustrator and Artist Sophie Blackall
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: What would you say to the one who got away? Artist Sophie Blackall's illustrations are inspired by the Internet's love lost and found.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Clothing Designer Ursula Dean
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: For clothing designer and mother-of-two Ursula Dean, creative work and family life form a harmonious whole.

episodes.title: All That Glitters: The History of Shiny Things
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Who isn't dazzled and enchanted by that wondrous stuff called glitter?

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Raspberry Jello Cosmo
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: At this year’s holiday party, serve up an undulating glass of fruity flavor.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Beantown Handmade's Dog Clothing
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Is there anything better than a dog in a bow tie? (We think not.) Crocheter Anne Burton found a muse in Bean, her adorable dog model.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Sword Maker
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: As one of Japan's last remaining swordsmiths, Korehira Watanabe has honed his craft for 40 years while attempting to recreate the mythical Koto sword.

episodes.title: Classic Wrecks: The Rusted Car as Art
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: John Findra's love of classic cars is given creative expression through scale models, affectionately reproducing the rusty beauty of abandoned autos.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Brooklyn Watches
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: David Sokosh found an unexpected vocation after his art gallery closed: watchmaker.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: USB Typewriter
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Inspired by fellow tech-savvy enthusiasts at Philadelphia's hackerspace Hive76, inventor Jack Zylkin gives new life to the vintage typewriter.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Sandhills Boot Company
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Former ranch hand Kyle Rosfeld found a new path making traditional cowboy boots.

episodes.title: There’s No Place Like Here: Sutton Clock Shop
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: As the year winds down, step into a place where time is of the essence.

episodes.title: There’s No Place Like Here: Liberty Tool
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: H.G. "Skip" Brack salvages tools from all over New England to resell at affordable prices, in an effort to support his local economy and craftsmen.

episodes.title: Breaking Local Bread: Wild Hive Farm
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: By bringing grain back to the Hudson Valley, Don Lewis is helping people develop a taste for their own neighborhood.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Halloween Mermaid Makeup Tutorial
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Embrace your inner siren with this lesson in cosmetic metamorphosis.

episodes.title: Leanne Marshall Takes on Fashion Week
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: We catch up with Leanne as she prepares to show her latest collection for New York Fashion Week.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: tUnE-yArDs
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: In this Etsy exclusive, Merrill Garbus, better known as tUnE-yArDs, talks about life in the loop.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Get Things Done
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Do you find yourself with not enough hours in the day? Check out these time-saving tips to maximize your daily schedule.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: How to Stay Cool
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Having trouble slogging through this steamy haze? There's more than just air conditioning to help you beat the heat.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: How to Make Mustard
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: While the debate over the world's greatest condiment rages on, turn up the heat with a recipe that takes this heavy contender to new heights.

episodes.title: Canning with Classie Parker
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Classie Parker remembers when everything you needed to know about integrity, guts, and the meaning of life was in the conversations of the kitchen.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Cocktail Umbrella Lantern
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Illuminate your outdoor soiree with a saucy summer lantern made from cocktail umbrellas.

episodes.title: Streetsy
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: In a twist on the street fashion genre, Etsy asks New Yorkers who made their clothing — and more importantly, if they care.

episodes.title: Urban Cheesecraft
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: With kits of citric acid and rennet tablets, Claudia Lucero proves cheese-making can be simple, local, and accessible to all.

episodes.title: There’s No Place Like Here: Brazenhead Books
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Tucked high above the bustle of the street, Michael's secret secondhand bookshop is a mecca for those who savor the story behind the volume.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Beerhorst Family
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Wherever Rick and Brenda Beerhorst go with their six kids, they inspire curiosity. From un-schooling to art-making, it's life as usual for the Beerhorst clan.

episodes.title: Stitching the Artisanal Football
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: In the hands of this leather craftsman, roots of the classic American pastime become tangible.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Kid-Friendly Bird Mobile
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: We team up with crafty dad Joel Henriques for the perfect Mother's Day project: a sweet memento that will complement her modern home.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Jewelry of Nanopod
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Travel through the dark dreams and inner turmoil of Tosca Hidalgo y Teran, where the glow of a blowtorch births the intangible.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Xenobia Bailey's Aesthetic of Funk
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: This fiber artist learned to "funk it together" by watching the women in her community beautify their environments with limited resources.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Papercutting of Rob Ryan
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: What could be a greater way to celebrate the world than acknowledging the beauty in the everyday?

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Liberty Vintage Motorcycles
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: In a crowded Philadelphia garage, Adam Cramer revives vintage motorcycles and the American tradition of grease-stained self-reliance.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Glassblowing with Kiva Ford
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Master craftsman Kiva Ford toes the line between scientific beakers and delicately curlicued vessels. At his Jersey City furnace, the intangible takes shape.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Make Your Own Hot Sauce
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Satiate the need for heat with a jar of your own liquid spice. The recipe's secret ingredient is sure to tickle the tip of your guests' jaded tongues.

episodes.title: There’s No Place Like Here: Hindsvik's Interior Design
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Join Daniel and Valeria a.k.a hindsvik on a video tour of their home, where Scandinavian and Japanese vintage pop in a minimalist environment.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Graphic Prints of Greg Beauchamp
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: In a world of disaster and heartache, it's easy to be jaded. One artist channels a brighter tomorrow with graphic prints of positivity.

episodes.title: Lacemaking in Lefkara, Cyprus
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Women in this quaint village have been embroidering lace since the 15th century. Now their regional handicraft faces the realities of globalization.

episodes.title: Tune Up Your Bicycle for Spring
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: With Susan Lindell from Brooklyn's Recycle-A-Bicycle leading the way, your dusty, rusty bike will be ready to roll in no time.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Hanoi’s Sugar Street
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: In Vietnam's capital where the Old Quarter is frenetic with change, one candy-maker holds out, confident in her sweets' enduring allure.

episodes.title: There’s No Place Like Here: Tokyo's Consignment Shop Pass the Baton
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Tokyo's consignment shop Pass the Baton not only sells used objects and clothing, but also the stories of their past and often-cherished lives.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Knitter Biscuit Scout
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: At the southernmost tip of Africa, Lynn Garret spends her days knitting sweaters for chairs and covers for washing machines.

episodes.title: No Place Like Here: Marfa, Texas
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Take a trip to the West Texas Chihuahuan Desert, where the road-side town of Marfa is an oasis for everything from stark cubes to crewelwork.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Molly Landreth's Photography
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Photographer Molly Landreth uses her large format camera as a tool of visibility, documenting gay and transgendered life in the U.S.

episodes.title: Process: Woodgrain Bike Frames
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: After a lifetime of painting custom car interiors, New Zealander Rob Pollock turns to woodgraining bicycles and gives the custom bike a whole new twist.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Plumbing Pipe Candlesticks
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: The industrial edge of plumbing supplies meets the soft curves of melting wax in this romantically inspired, home decor How-Tuesday.

episodes.title: Process: Marionettes with Geahk Burchill
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Witness master puppet maker Geahk Burchill breathe life into Asenath, the Appalachian witch.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: The Straight Shave
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: As Olive Oyl once sang, "I want a clean-shaven man." Join us as we learn how to achieve this old-fashioned barbershop technique at home.

episodes.title: It Gets Better: Etsy Admin
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Etsy Admin, gay and straight, share testimonials of bullying, strife and wisdom gleaned from their teen years. To anyone struggling: we hear you.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Light Bulb Terrariums
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Just because the first flurries have decimated your window garden, there's no need to settle for a season lackluster and dreary.

episodes.title: Process: Plastination with Dr. Christoph von Horst
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: What lies beyond skin and bone? Dr. Christoph von Horst embeds animal cross-sections in lucite for a craft that unites anatomy and art.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Fasion Designer Riordan Roache
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Fashion designer Emily Riordan Roache forwent the corporate path in favor of focusing on her own line of sophisticated textures and modern elegance.

episodes.title: Dottie Angel’s Once Upon a Time
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Step into the bohemian dreams of Tif Fussell, whose whimsical and feminine textile creations caught the eye of UPPERCASE founder Janine Vangool.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Native Alaskan Artist Mabel Pike
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: With a deep-seated passion for beading, Tlingit Native elder Mabel Pike is dedicated to passing on the traditions of her clan's culture.

episodes.title: FACARO: Recycled Bicycle Chandeliers
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Carolina Fontoura Alzaga's social and political consciousness are reflected in the salvaged bicycle chandeliers she creates.

episodes.title: Costumes, New Orleans Style
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: This costumer's passion for her city is channeled through spandex, feathers, glitter, and over-the-top chapeaus.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Public Art of Maya Hayuk
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Muralist Maya Hayuk creates more than just a painting on the wall in Braddock, PA,  a once-thriving steel mill town.

episodes.title: Jim Power and the Mosaic Trail
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: For over thirty years, Jim Power has been transforming Manhattan's East Village with mosaics, one lamppost at a time.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: LePinkChocolat's Handcraftted Jewelry
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Karolina Kubik's handcrafted jewelry is an homage to the ultimate cultural pleasure, the French patisserie.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Silk-screening with 1AEON
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Etsians Tara Young and Bre Pettis met with Gabe Molnar of 1AEON in his home in Brooklyn to talk about dreams, rock and roll and how silk-screening saved his life.

episodes.title: There’s No Place Like Here: Boudoir Queen
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Boudoirqueen is a shop that inspires the imagination, so we decided to step into Dawn's Younger-Smith's world and see what inspires her. She lined her Austin, Texas, showroom with her collection of all things 1920s fringe, droopy lace, boudoir doll and utterly, breathlessly feminine clothing.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Fiber Artist Artstew
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Back in the 1970s, Holly Stewart, aka Artstew, was a single mom trying to raise two daughters. Holly decided to forgo art school to support her family, ultimately paying the bills and gaining respect within her Oklahoma City community by becoming a police officer. Even as she put in her time with the force (15 years!), she was always drawing.

episodes.title: Process: Kim Westad's Ceramic Pottery
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Like a phoenix from ashes, Kim concedes that if she can make something once — even if it fails — she can always make it better a second time.

episodes.title: Process: Farm Tables with David Ellison
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Rather than turn his nose up at boards with rusty old bolts, David Ellison highlights these markings as part of the history in his furniture.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Antique Shopping with Domestikate
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: While most folks at the country auction look for rustic butter churns, Kate Fix seeks out the odds and ends that make a collection one of a kind.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Art Dolls of Black-eyed Suzie
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Sarah Faber's art dolls tell tales of dire lives of Victorian England, but not without a certain playful wink.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Sharon Montrose's Photography
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Photographer Sharon Montrose first picked up a camera at age fifteen in a high school Photo 101 class. Sharon says that when she picked up a camera "it was my breath, I was like I'm alive now."

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Pets With Fez Persian Rugs
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: After learning to weave at the young age of six, Babajan knew he had found his calling.

episodes.title: A Letterpress Legacy with Lucky Duck Press
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Patrick Barrett of Lucky Duck Press inherited his antique foot-powered letterpress from the family business. His great-grandfather started The Sterling Press back in 1901, first printing paper goods and then moving on to cloth tapes. Patrick grew up watching his dad work the manual presses but didn't express interest until many years later, after studying theater in college.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Handmade Tools with Old School Tools
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Forgoing formal schooling, Orien MacDonald immersed himself in woodworking and blacksmithing to uphold the values of the Back-to-the-Land movement.

episodes.title: Process: Bone Flutes with Catherine Thompson
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: What began as a clothing line producing hand-sewn T-shirts, Alabama Chanin now empowers local economies across the South.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Sculptor and Painter Jason Tennant
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Sculptor and painter Jason Tennant hunts through the woods near the Finger Lakes of New York for the materials and inspiration of his wild yet graceful pieces.

episodes.title: Butch Anthony’s Museum of Wonder
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Wend your way through this perpetually-evolving Alabama compound, where artifacts, oddities, and folk art take root.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Crocheting with YOKOO
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Crocheting 15 hours a day, Yokoo intertwines the worlds of utility and philosophy.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: The Paper Arts of Dr. Kennedy Jones
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: To Hollie Chastain, old books are like treasure chests, reflecting the lives of owners past. Her mixed media collages meld music, story and history.

episodes.title: Alabama Chanin: A Cottage Industry Success Story
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: What began as a clothing line producing hand-sewn T-shirts, Alabama Chanin now empowers local economies across the South.

episodes.title: How-Tuesday: Needle Felted Eyeballs
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: In today's special Halloween project, Nguyen Le of KnitKnit shows how to make a creepy finishing touch for your haunted party.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Ole Man's BBQ Rub
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: For Joe Threat creating the ultimate Kansas City barbecue rub has been a lifelong quest.

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Jevgenia's Paper Mache Masks
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary: Yevgeniya Kilupe, a Holocaust survivor and self-taught artist, started making masks to supplement her pension after a life of working in the factory.

episodes.title: An Etsy Valentine!
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary:
Megan Whitmarsh’s whimsical embroideries come to life in this short video we’ve created just for you. Won’t you be our Valentine?

Art by: 
Megan Whitmarsh
http://meganwhitmarsh.com

Music by: 
Becky Stark & Peter Glantz
https://www.facebook.com/lavender.diamond
http://www.imaginarycompany.org

Animation by:
Matthew Salata
https://vimeo.com/17711573

episodes.title: Liberating Lingerie
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary:
Virginie Rouffignac (http://nonoslingeries.etsy.com) designs lingeries for rule breakers and free spirits.

Read the Etsy blog post: http://etsy.me/nonoslingeries. 

Directed by:
Sonia Gonzalez
http://soniadmgonzalez.wordpress.com

Music by:
Junip
http://junip.net

I'm From Barcelona
http://imfrombarcelona.com

Ed Kurz

episodes.title: Are You a Twenty Four Hour Woman?
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary:
365 illustrations of a woman tackling everything from air conditioner installation to alligators are a compellingly quirky take on female empowerment.

Read the Etsy blog post: http://etsy.me/24hrwoman.

Directed, shot & edited by:
Alex Rappoport
http://www.alexrappoport.com

Music by:
Mark McAdam
http://www.markmcadam.com

episodes.title: Dress Your Door: The Modern Wreath
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary:
Today's wreaths have moved far beyond the traditional twist of greenery thanks to a group of impassioned makers who've put their own stamp on the art.

Read the Etsy blog post: http://etsy.me/wreaths.

Directed by:
Jeremy Workman
http://jeremyworkman.com

Music:
"All The Trimmings", "Dance of the Woodland Pixies", "Pea Pod"
Written by and courtesy of Audio Network US, Inc.
http://us.audionetwork.com

"Winter Sprout", "Elves"
Written by Karen Altman
http://twigstudio.net

episodes.title: Handmade Portraits: Milliner Behida Dolić
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary:
Hat-maker Behida Dolić (http://yellowfield7.etsy.com) shares a glimpse of her creative process in this video look book.

Read the Etsy blog post: http://etsy.me/behidadolic.

Directed, shot & edited by:
Dan Estabrook
http://danestabrook.com

Music by:
Michael Leviton 
http://michaelleviton.com

episodes.title: Shoes With Soul
episodes.author: Etsy, Inc.
episodes.summary:
An artisan (http://afourcustom.etsy.com) shares his passion for handcrafted shoes with admiring customers all over the world.

Read the Etsy blog post: http://etsy.me/afourcustom.

Directed, shot, & edited by: 
We Make Them Wonder
http://wemakethemwonder.com

Music by:
Matt Abeysekera
http://bromeliadmusic.com
